title: Get Started
text_preview: Learn about building information modeling, the user interface, and more.  Topics in this section

title: Video Gallery
text_preview: These tutorials walk you through the process of creating a simple building model using Revit, and introduce Revit user interface. Use the filter to narrow your search.  Useful features that you might not have tried yet.  Learn about different ways to work with team members on Revit projects.  Create the building model by adding architectural elements, structural elements, and MEP systems. Add desi

title: Revit Analytics Program
text_preview: Learn about Revit analytics program and how you can choose to participate.

title: Revit Fundamentals
text_preview: Learn how working in Revit differs from traditional 2D design methods.

title: Online Training
text_preview: Access resources that can help you learn how to use the software.

title: Tutorials
text_preview: These lessons step through the process of creating a simple building model using Revit .  Download this zip file and extract its contents for the complete set of files needed to complete the tutorial series. These tutorials and videos apply only to Architectural modeling, and not to Structural or MEP modeling.  The following image illustrates the resulting project that you create during the tutori

toc_title: Part 1: Create a Project and Add Levels
title: Part 1: Create a Project and Add Levels
text_preview: In this exercise, you start a project and create levels for the foundation, store floor, upper and lower parapets of the building model.  When you create levels, you can choose to have the corresponding views created at the same time. Before you begin, download the GSG_01_Getting_Started_Template.rte template. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tu

title: Part 2: Create Walls
text_preview: In this exercise, you work on different levels to add exterior walls, interior walls and a corridor to the project.  Before you begin, download the GSG_02_Create_Walls.rvt data file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  These points were added to the project to make it easier to draw the walls to specific lo

toc_title: Part 3: Create a Terrain and Building Pad
title: Part 3: Create a Terrain and Building Pad
text_preview: In this exercise, you add topography to the building site.  Add points at different elevations to create the terrain and create a building pad based on the foundation walls of the building. Before you begin, download the GSG_03_Terrain_Pad.rvt tutorial file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Part 4: Creat

title: Part 5: Create a Roof
text_preview: In this exercise, you create a flat roof using the footprint of the exterior walls and a sloped roof with an overhang at the entry.  Before you begin, download the GSG_05_add_roof.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Notice that the interior walls extend through the roof.  Notice that the walls no

title: Part 6: Place Doors
text_preview: In this exercise, you load door types into the project, and then add interior and exterior doors to the model.  Before you begin, download the GSG_06_place_doors.rvt, M_Door-Exterior-Double.rvt, M_Door-Overhead-Sectional, M_Door-Passage-Double-Flush-Dbl_Acting, and M_Door-Passage-Single-Flush tutorial files. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tuto

In this exercise, you work in elevation and plan views to add windows to the model. You use alignment and dimension tools to more precisely position the windows.  Before you begin, download the GSG_07_place_windows.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Note that each of the 4 dimensions is different

title: Part 9: Create Stairs and Railings
text_preview: In this exercise, you complete the interior of the model by adding a staircase to the mezzanine on the lower level, then modifying the railing on the mezzanine.  Before you begin, download the GSG_09_stairs_railings.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  You will create a railing at the edge of the m

title: Part 10: Create Views
text_preview: In this exercise, you create a section view, a callout view of the exterior wall, and a detail callout of the parapet.  Before you begin, download the GSG_10_views.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Part 11: Adding Dimensions

title: Part 11: Add Dimensions
text_preview: In this exercise, you add dimensions to the building model to dimension the footprint of the main building.  Before you begin, download the GSG_11_dimensions.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Part 12: Adding Notes

title: Part 12: Add Notes
text_preview: In this exercise, you add annotations to a plan view of the building model.  Before you begin, download the GSG_12_notes.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  Part 13: Creating Sheets

title: Part 13: Create Sheets
text_preview: In this exercise, you create a sheet and add multiple views to the sheet.  You add a section view to the sheet and see that the section mark in the plan view is updated to include the sheet information. Before you begin, download the GSG_13_sheets.rvt file. Download this zip file (if you have not already downloaded the exercise files for the tutorials.)  Objectives  Watch the video  An outline of

title: Beginner Workflows
text_preview: Learn how to perform typical tasks using the software.

title: Industry Workflows
text_preview: Learn best practices and key workflows using Revit and other products in 20 minutes a day.  The Customer Success Learning Hub provides learning paths for key disciplines within the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industry. Select your discipline and review learning paths that will help you learn more about workflows using Revit.  Use the learning paths to get the most out of Revit as y

title: Essential Skills
text_preview: Review the terms and concepts, and watch these videos for an introduction to the basics of using Revit .  If you are new to Revit , watch these videos and review the associated information to learn the foundation skills you need to get started with the software.  Video: Tour the User Interface  To find more videos, search for "video:" in the search bar.

title: User Interface
text_preview: Learn how to use and customize the user interface to increase productivity and simplify your workflow.    This video demonstrates the following:  This is a modal window.  To get started, you can open a project or family, or create either one from a template. You can also open a recently used file by clicking the project. The user interface provides all of the tools you need to work in a model.  Th

title: Cloud Services
text_preview: Revit provides access to a growing family of integrated cloud services.  Use cloud services to collaborate on projects with distributed teams, perform analysis and simulations, render images, and more.  Some cloud services are available for no additional charge when you are an Autodesk subscriber. Other cloud services require cloud credits.

title: Autodesk for Government
text_preview: Autodesk for Government is available for U.S. government users and provides access to Revit Cloud Worksharing.

title: Creating Models
text_preview: When you are ready to begin a new design in Revit , create a model.  Use any of the following methods:

title: Opening Files
text_preview: Open a Revit file to work on a model or family.  To open a Revit file, use any of the following methods:

title: Saving Files
text_preview: Save files, define save options and reminders, and manage backup files and journal files.  To save a file, do any of the following:  To save the current file to a different file name or location, click File tab (Save As).  If you are working in a project that has worksharing enabled and you want to save your changes to the central model, click Collaborate tab Synchronize panel Synchronize with Cen

title: Licensing
text_preview: When you first launch the software, the Let's Get Started screen displays. Select the appropriate option to specify your license method.  After specifying your license information, you can later review or change it if needed.  To manage your Revit license:

title: Sample Files
text_preview: Explore Revit , learn its capabilities, and see working models that demonstrate the value of BIM.
